DESCRIPTION: lprm  cancels  print jobs that have been queued for printing.  If no arguments are supplied, the current job on the default destination is canceled.  You can specify one or more job ID numbers to cancel those jobs  or use the - option to cancel all jobs.
EXAMPLES: Cancel the current job on the default printer:
SEE ALSO cancel(1), lp(1), lpq(1), lpr(1), lpstat(1), CUPS Online Help (http://localhost:631/help)
NAME: lprm - cancel print jobs
OPTIONS: The lprm command supports the following options:
-E   Forces encryption when connecting to the server.
-P destination[/instance] Specifies the destination printer or class.
CONFORMING TO The CUPS version of lprm is compatible with the standard Berkeley command of the same name.
